newsitem.title: JAPAN: MITI says weak yen more positive for Japan - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: MITI says weak yen more positive for Japan - Jiji.

text.p: Japanese Vice Trade Minister Tsutomu Makino was quoted as saying on Tuesday that the weak yen was more positive than negative for the country's economy at the moment.
Makino, speaking at a news conference in Nagoya, central Japan, said it was not favourable for foreign exchange rates to move up or down drastically, Jiji said.

"We need to keep watch, but I can't say that the yen falling below 125 yen against the dollar would immediately become a problem. I think the weak yen for now is more positive (than negative) for the economy," Makino was quoted as saying.
"I'm not worried that the trade surplus will increase and cause trade friction," he was quoted as saying.
